poem:
**Freedom of Birmingham**

An honor in shadows,  
gentle rain whispers—  
Ozzy and echoes  
threading through alleys—  
metal gods' anthem  
in city's embrace,  
guitars hum night air.  
Between brick and breath,  
a chord strikes, silence  
listens, as history  
forges its own  
shining Sabbath.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Ozzy Osbourne ‘very proud’ as Birmingham to honour Black Sabbath Being awarded the Freedom of Birmingham “means a lot” to Ozzy Osbourne and the members of Black Sabbath, Sharon Osbourne has said, after the city council approved the honour. Ozzy, alongside the founding band members, Tony Iommi, Terence Butler and Bill Ward, will be given the honorary title in recognition of their service to the city, after councillors gave it the go-ahead on Tuesday. The". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
